intro: Calea peduncularis, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Calea peduncularis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in warm climates.
